articles.headline: Trump Turns to His Right Flank to Fill National Security Posts
articles.snippet: The president-elect on Friday tapped loyalists who reflect the hard-line views of his campaign, though he is also expected to meet with critics such as Mitt Romney.
articles.abstract: The president-elect on Friday tapped loyalists who reflect the hard-line views of his campaign, though he is also expected to meet with critics such as Mitt Romney.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump moved quickly on Friday to begin filling national security posts at the top echelons of his administration, selecting a group of hawks and campaign loyalists who reflect the hard-line views that defined his run for president.

articles.headline: The Kind of Car Insurer That Gives Consumers the Best Value
articles.snippet: Mutual insurance companies owned by policyholders paid claims at a higher rate, providing the best value to consumers, a study found.
articles.abstract: Mutual insurance companies owned by policyholders paid claims at a higher rate, providing the best value to consumers, a study found.
articles.lead_paragraph: Are people better off when they buy things from companies that don’t have public shareholders they need to please?

articles.headline: Ford Move, Cited as Victory by Trump, Has No Effect on U.S. Jobs
articles.snippet: The Kentucky factory already operates around the clock at full capacity, and Lincoln MKCs are only a small portion of the vehicles made there.
articles.abstract: The Kentucky factory already operates around the clock at full capacity, and Lincoln MKCs are only a small portion of the vehicles made there.
articles.lead_paragraph: Judging from a couple of Twitter messages by President-elect Donald J. Trump, he had scored a hard-won victory for American autoworkers by persuading Ford Motor to keep a Lincoln plant in Louisville, Ky., rather than move it to Mexico.

articles.headline: Donald Trump Agrees to Pay $25 Million in Trump University Settlement
articles.snippet: Former students said they were cheated out of thousands of dollars in tuition, and one of the cases was set to go before a jury in 10 days.
articles.abstract: Former students said they were cheated out of thousands of dollars in tuition, and one of the cases was set to go before a jury in 10 days.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump has reversed course and agreed on Friday to pay $25 million to settle a series of lawsuits stemming from his defunct for-profit education venture, Trump University, finally putting to rest fraud allegations by former students, which have dogged him for years and hampered his presidential campaign.

articles.headline: With National Security Choices, Trump Builds Team to Bulldoze Status Quo
articles.snippet: By selecting Jeff Sessions, Mike Pompeo and Michael T. Flynn, Mr. Trump moved to realize his campaign’s vision of relentlessly enforcing immigration laws and viewing Muslims with suspicion.
articles.abstract: By selecting Jeff Sessions, Mike Pompeo and Michael T. Flynn, Mr. Trump moved to realize his campaign’s vision of relentlessly enforcing immigration laws and viewing Muslims with suspicion.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump’s trio of hard-line selections on Friday served notice that he intends not only to reverse eight years of liberal domestic policies but also to overturn decades of bipartisan consensus on the United States’ proper role in world affairs.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo and Mark Landler

articles.headline: Should Trump Undo Investor Protections? Meet the Brokers of Madison County
articles.snippet: Many brokers with troubled pasts are still running amok without their customers’ knowing their histories or their employers’ seeming to care much.
articles.abstract: Many brokers with troubled pasts are still running amok without their customers’ knowing their histories or their employers’ seeming to care much.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW WOODSTOCK, N.Y. — No, not that Woodstock, the one of peace, love and extremely good vibes.

articles.headline: Fixation on Fake News Overshadows Waning Trust in Real Reporting
articles.snippet: Fake news should be shunned, but the discussion of it misunderstands a new media world in which every story is at risk of being discredited, not by argument but by sheer force.
articles.abstract: Fake news should be shunned, but the discussion of it misunderstands a new media world in which every story is at risk of being discredited, not by argument but by sheer force.
articles.lead_paragraph: Something is deeply wrong when the pope’s voice, reputation and influence can be borrowed by a source that describes itself as “a fantasy news site” to claim that he has endorsed a presidential candidate, and then be amplified, unchallenged, through a million individual shares.

articles.headline: Diplomats Confront New Threat to Paris Climate Pact: Donald Trump
articles.snippet: Amid Mr. Trump’s calls to withdraw from the accord, some negotiators began planning how to punish the United States if he follows through.
articles.abstract: Amid Mr. Trump’s calls to withdraw from the accord, some negotiators began planning how to punish the United States if he follows through.
articles.lead_paragraph: MARRAKESH, Morocco — Diplomats from around the world converged here this week with the plan to put details on last year’s Paris climate accord and move the globe closer to controlling the industrial emissions that are heating the planet.

articles.headline: The Race for a Zika Vaccine
articles.snippet: Vaccines usually take a decade or more to develop, but researchers say a Zika vaccine could be available as early as 2018, thanks in part to experimental DNA technology.
articles.abstract: Vaccines usually take a decade or more to develop, but researchers say a Zika vaccine could be available as early as 2018, thanks in part to experimental DNA technology.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADISON, Wis. — The Zika virus thrives in tropical climates. But it is also growing in this cold-weather city — up a flight of stairs, past a flier for lunchtime yoga and behind a locked door. That is where scientists working in a lab for Takeda, the Japanese drug company, inspect and test vials of the virus.

articles.headline: Italy’s Banks Are in a Slow-Motion Crisis. And Europe May Pay.
articles.snippet: Squeezed by bad loans, Italian lenders are starving a weak economy of capital, which may keep the rest of Europe from regaining its economic vigor.
articles.abstract: Squeezed by bad loans, Italian lenders are starving a weak economy of capital, which may keep the rest of Europe from regaining its economic vigor.
articles.lead_paragraph: MILAN — Victor Massiah has grown weary of talk that the Italian banking system is so threadbare and stuffed with terrible loans that it threatens Europe with another financial crisis.

articles.headline: High in Tower, Trump Reads, Tweets and Plans
articles.snippet: As Donald J. Trump goes about his routine — schmoozing, tweeting, rewarding loyalty, fomenting infighting — it doesn’t appear the gravity of the presidency is changing him.
articles.abstract: As Donald J. Trump goes about his routine — schmoozing, tweeting, rewarding loyalty, fomenting infighting — it doesn’t appear the gravity of the presidency is changing him.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump sits high in Trump Tower in New York, spending hours on the phone with friends, television personalities and donors to ask if they know people to recommend for his cabinet.
articles.byline: By Ashley Parker and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Trump Meets With Romney as He Starts to Look Outside His Inner Circle
articles.snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump on Saturday moved to mend fences with rivals, meeting with Mitt Romney to discuss naming him secretary of state.
articles.abstract: President-elect Donald J. Trump on Saturday moved to mend fences with rivals, meeting with Mitt Romney to discuss naming him secretary of state.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEDMINSTER, N.J. — President-elect Donald J. Trump on Saturday moved to mend fences with political rivals after a divisive campaign, meeting with Mitt Romney, who had scathingly criticized him during the race as “a phony” and “a fraud,” to discuss naming him as secretary of state.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Julie Hirschfeld Davis

articles.headline: The In-Law in the Trump Inner Circle: Jared Kushner’s Steadying Hand
articles.snippet: In the chaos that often seems to surround President-elect Trump, his son-in-law injects optimism and reinforces Mr. Trump’s world views and instincts.
articles.abstract: In the chaos that often seems to surround President-elect Trump, his son-in-law injects optimism and reinforces Mr. Trump’s world views and instincts.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was the low point for a campaign that had been in steady decline for weeks.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Mahler and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: At Iowa High School, Election Results Kindle Tensions and Protests
articles.snippet: Like many other schools around the country since the election, West High has become a microcosm of the United States, roiled by divisions and mistrust.
articles.abstract: Like many other schools around the country since the election, West High has become a microcosm of the United States, roiled by divisions and mistrust.
articles.lead_paragraph: IOWA CITY — The air felt leaden in the hallways at West High School on the morning after Election Day. The usual clatter from the building’s 2,000 students was muffled. At lunchtime, Lujayn Hamad was in the cafeteria when she said a boy she barely knew roughly bumped into her and swore at her.

articles.headline: ‘Hamilton’ Cast’s Appeal to Pence Ignites Showdown With Trump
articles.snippet: Donald Trump took to Twitter to demand an apology from the cast of “Hamilton,” which directly addressed Vice President-elect Mike Pence after a performance on Friday.
articles.abstract: Donald Trump took to Twitter to demand an apology from the cast of “Hamilton,” which directly addressed Vice President-elect Mike Pence after a performance on Friday.
articles.lead_paragraph: A surprising confrontation erupted on Saturday between President-elect Donald J. Trump and the cast and creators of the Broadway hit “Hamilton,” setting off furious debate over American principles like free speech, respect and the ability to challenge authority in the Trump era.

articles.headline: Killers on a Shoestring: Inside the Gangs of El Salvador
articles.snippet: The gangs that make El Salvador the murder capital of the world are not sophisticated global cartels but mafias of the poor.
articles.abstract: The gangs that make El Salvador the murder capital of the world are not sophisticated global cartels but mafias of the poor.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN SALVADOR — On a sultry evening in late July, the Salvadoran authorities executed their very first assault on what they called the financial cupola of Mara Salvatrucha, or MS-13, the largest of the ruthless gangs that have made El Salvador the murder capital of the world.
articles.byline: By Óscar Martínez, Efren Lemus, Carlos Martínez and Deborah Sontag

articles.headline: Trump Turns Staid Process Into Spectacle as Aspirants Parade to His Door
articles.snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump hinted strongly that he was considering picking James N. Mattis, a retired Marine Corps general, to be defense secretary.
articles.abstract: President-elect Donald J. Trump hinted strongly that he was considering picking James N. Mattis, a retired Marine Corps general, to be defense secretary.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEDMINSTER, N.J. — President-elect Donald J. Trump has turned the vital, but normally inscrutable, process of forming a government into a Trump-branded, made-for-television spectacle, parading his finalists for top administration positions this weekend before reporters and the world.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: How Fake News Goes Viral: A Case Study
articles.snippet: How a misinformed Twitter post the night after the presidential election fueled a nationwide conspiracy theory and became a talking point — even as it was being proved false.
articles.abstract: How a misinformed Twitter post the night after the presidential election fueled a nationwide conspiracy theory and became a talking point — even as it was being proved false.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eric Tucker, a 35-year-old co-founder of a marketing company in Austin, Tex., had just about 40 Twitter followers. But his recent tweet about paid protesters being bused to demonstrations against President-elect Donald J. Trump fueled a nationwide conspiracy theory — one that Mr. Trump joined in promoting.

articles.headline: ‘Fantastic Beasts’ Is a Hit for Warner Bros.
articles.snippet: The J.K. Rowling-scripted fantasy is a boon for the studio, whose last three big-budget efforts drew cool reactions from critics.
articles.abstract: The J.K. Rowling-scripted fantasy is a boon for the studio, whose last three big-budget efforts drew cool reactions from critics.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Warner Bros. and J. K. Rowling pulled off an exceptionally difficult magic trick over the weekend. Not only did they bring the “Harry Potter” film franchise back to life, they also did it without Harry Potter.

articles.headline: How Apple Empowers, and Employs, the American Working Class
articles.snippet: The tech giant probably won’t bring all production to the United States, as Donald Trump has suggested, but it provides diverse opportunities for thousands of Americans, along with a ladder to climb.
articles.abstract: The tech giant probably won’t bring all production to the United States, as Donald Trump has suggested, but it provides diverse opportunities for thousands of Americans, along with a ladder to climb.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. — During the presidential campaign, President-elect Donald J. Trump complained that America had lost too many manufacturing jobs and promised to force big companies like Apple to bring that work home. “I’m going to get Apple to start making their computers and their iPhones on our land, not in China,” he said.

articles.headline: Indian Business Partners Hope to Exploit Their Ties to Donald Trump
articles.snippet: A meeting last week with Indian developers highlights the potential for conflict stemming from his businesses and his role as president.
articles.abstract: A meeting last week with Indian developers highlights the potential for conflict stemming from his businesses and his role as president.
articles.lead_paragraph: PUNE, India — It is a daunting proposition to put $2 million apartments on the market in Pune — a quiet industrial city in the west of India, where even the fanciest neighborhoods are lined with squat housing blocks.
articles.byline: By Ayesha Venkataraman, Ellen Barry and Eric Lipton

articles.headline: The Future of Health Care Mergers Under Trump
articles.snippet: Legal experts say Donald Trump’s election could change how vigorously the federal government handles two giant deals and others in the industry.
articles.abstract: Legal experts say Donald Trump’s election could change how vigorously the federal government handles two giant deals and others in the industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: The proposed health insurance mega-merger between Anthem and Cigna heads to court on Monday, as the companies face off against a Justice Department seeking to block their $48 billion deal. It will be followed in just a few weeks by the trial for another proposed insurance mega-merger, between Aetna and Humana.

articles.headline: Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook Must Defend the Truth
articles.snippet: As the mainstream news media work to separate fact from fiction, Facebook — which has gobbled up much of the online ad market — must do its part.
articles.abstract: As the mainstream news media work to separate fact from fiction, Facebook — which has gobbled up much of the online ad market — must do its part.
articles.lead_paragraph: Friday night, the Facebook co-founder Mark Zuckerberg went on his vast social network to convince an expanding chorus of critics — including the departing president of the United States — that he honest-to-goodness wants to combat the “fake news” that is running wild across his site and others, and turning our politics into a paranoiac fantasy come to life.

articles.headline: Dallas Stares Down a Texas-Size Threat of Bankruptcy
articles.snippet: Decades of faulty assumptions by pension officials have left the city struggling with more pension debt, relative to its resources, than any major American city except Chicago.
articles.abstract: Decades of faulty assumptions by pension officials have left the city struggling with more pension debt, relative to its resources, than any major American city except Chicago.
articles.lead_paragraph: DALLAS — Picture the next major American city to go bankrupt. What springs to mind? Probably not the swagger and sprawl of Dallas.

articles.headline: Alt-Right Gathering Exults in Trump Election With Nazi-Era Salute
articles.snippet: The alt-right, an extremist fringe popular with white supremacists, has celebrated the election of Donald J. Trump, and now hopes to have the ear of his White House.
articles.abstract: The alt-right, an extremist fringe popular with white supremacists, has celebrated the election of Donald J. Trump, and now hopes to have the ear of his White House.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — By the time Richard B. Spencer, the leading ideologue of the alt-right movement and the final speaker of the night, rose to address a gathering of his followers on Saturday, the crowd was restless.
